Linear inequalities

1. Revision of single variable inequalities

Solving linear inequalities

  1. Solve for xx:

    x−45≥−3(x+2)6x−45≥−3(x+2)6
    INSTRUCTION: Your answer should be a complete inequality statement. For example: x > 5 or x <= 3/10.
    Answer: The solution is .
    relational
    HINT: <no title>
    [−0 points ⇒ 4 / 4 points left]

    Whenever you have an equation with fractions, you can multiply by the LCD to cancel the denominators! The same is true for inequalities. What is the LCD in this case?

    STEP: <no title>
    [−2 points ⇒ 2 / 4 points left]

    As usual when you have an equation or inequality with fractions, it is a good idea to start by removing the denominators. Then simplify each side.

    x−456(x−4)6x−24≥−3(x+2)6≥−15(x+2)≥−15x−30x−45≥−3(x+2)66(x−4)≥−15(x+2)6x−24≥−15x−30
    STEP: <no title>
    [−2 points ⇒ 0 / 4 points left]

    Now solve. (Remember to flip the inequality symbol if you multiply or divide by a negative.)

    6x−246x+15x21x∴x≥−15x−30≥−30+24≥−6≥−276x−24≥−15x−306x+15x≥−30+2421x≥−6∴x≥−27

Solving linear inequalities

  1. Solve for xx:

    −2x+1>−4(x−4)−2x+1>−4(x−4)
    INSTRUCTION: Your answer should be a complete inequality statement. For example: x > 5 or x <= 3/10.
    Answer: The answer is: .
    relational
    HINT: <no title>
    [−0 points ⇒ 4 / 4 points left]

    Think of this like you think of an equation: you can solve it almost exactly the same as you solve an equation.

    STEP: Simplify the inequality
    [−1 point ⇒ 3 / 4 points left]

    Simplify each side of the inequality as much as possible:

    −2x+1−2x+1>−4(x−4)>−4x+16−2x+1>−4(x−4)−2x+1>−4x+16
    STEP: Simplify even further by collecting like-terms
    [−3 points ⇒ 0 / 4 points left]

    Now solve the inequality following the same method that you usually use to solve linear inequalities.

    −2x+1−2x+4x2x∴x>−4x+16>16−1>15>152−2x+1>−4x+16−2x+4x>16−12x>15∴x>152

    The correct solution for the inequality is x>152x>152.

Solving linear inequalities

  1. Solve for xx:

    5(x+3)−1≥−4x+35(x+3)−1≥−4x+3
    INSTRUCTION: Your answer should be a complete inequality statement. For example: x > 5 or x <= 3/10.
    Answer: The solution is: .
    relational
    HINT: <no title>
    [−0 points ⇒ 3 / 3 points left]

    Start by multiplying the brackets on the left side of the equation, and then collecting like terms. After that, you will need to solve by bring the xx-terms to one side of the equation and the constant terms to the other side.

    STEP: Simplify each side of the inequality
    [−1 point ⇒ 2 / 3 points left]

    Simplify the inequality on each side as much as you can:

    5(x+3)−15x+15−15x+14≥−4x+3≥−4x+3≥−4x+35(x+3)−1≥−4x+35x+15−1≥−4x+35x+14≥−4x+3
    STEP: Combine the xx-terms together and solve the inequality
    [−2 points ⇒ 0 / 3 points left]

    Next, solve the inequality. Remember that for inequalities, if you multiply or divide both sides by a negative number, then you must flip the inequality sign around to the other direction!

    5x+145x+4x9x∴x≥−4x+3≥3−14≥−11≥−1195x+14≥−4x+35x+4x≥3−149x≥−11∴x≥−119

    The correct answer is x≥−119x≥−119.

    Submit your answer as:

  2. Write the answer in interval notation.

    INSTRUCTION: You can write infinity, ∞∞, as "oo", two small letter o's.
    Answer: x∈x∈
    interval
    HINT: <no title>
    [−0 points ⇒ 2 / 2 points left]
    For interval notation, << becomes: )); and ≥≥ becomes: [[.
    STEP: Rewrite the answer to Question 1 in interval notation
    [−2 points ⇒ 0 / 2 points left]

Solving linear inequalities

  1. Solve for xx:

    12x+25(x+3)<−25x+412x+25(x+3)<−25x+4
    INSTRUCTION: Your answer should be a complete inequality statement. For example: x > 5 or x <= 3/10.
    Answer: The solution is .
    relational
    HINT: <no title>
    [−0 points ⇒ 4 / 4 points left]

    STEP: <no title>
    [−2 points ⇒ 2 / 4 points left]

    Begin by cancelling the denominators. In this case, you can do that by multiplying both sides of the inequality by 1010 (which is the LCD of all of the fractions).

    12x+25(x+3)5x+4(x+3)<−25x+4<−4x+4012x+25(x+3)<−25x+45x+4(x+3)<−4x+40
    STEP: <no title>
    [−2 points ⇒ 0 / 4 points left]

    Continue by simplifying each side of the inequality as usual. Then work out the final answer.

    5x+4x+125x+4x+4x13x∴x<−4x+40<40−12<28<28135x+4x+12<−4x+405x+4x+4x<40−1213x<28∴x<2813

    The solution is x<2813x<2813.

    w−4≤−8orw−4>10w−4≤−8orw−4>10
    INSTRUCTION: Your answer will be a complete inequality statement. For example, it might look like one of these:

    relational
    HINT: <no title>
    [−0 points ⇒ 4 / 4 points left]

    The inequality has four sides; whatever you do to solve it, you must do the same thing to all four sides.

    STEP: <no title>
    [−4 points ⇒ 0 / 4 points left]

    This is a compound inequality - it has more than two sides! You can still use the basic idea you have always used with equations: do the same thing to all of the sides that you have.

    w−4ww≤≤≤−8−8+4−4orororw−4ww>>>1010+414w−4≤−8orw−4>10w≤−8+4orw>10+4w≤−4orw>14
    NOTE: You can think of this interval on the number line, as shown in red here. The solution consists of two separate parts of the number line.

  2. Write the answer in interval notation.

    INSTRUCTION:
    • If you need to type infinity, type two small letter o's: oo.
    • If you need to type a union, use the capital letter U.
    Answer: w∈w∈
    interval
    HINT: <no title>
    [−0 points ⇒ 2 / 2 points left]

    If the inequality involved "or" than you need to use the symbol "U" which means the Union of two groups.

    STEP: <no title>
    [−2 points ⇒ 0 / 2 points left]

    The solution to the inequality is two separate intervals. Therefore the answer in interval notation will be two separate pieces, connected by 'U' meaning Union. Using the word 'or' will have the same meaning and will be accepted.

    w∈(−∞;−4]∪(14;∞)w∈(−∞;−4]∪(14;∞)

    (When using interval notation you must put the smaller number first (on the left) and the larger number on the right!)
